section.heading: Chore services—Legislative policy and intent regarding available funds—Levels of service

content.p: The degree of service need, and the extent to which an individual is dependent upon such services to remain in his or her home or return to his or her home;
The availability of personal or community resources which may be utilized to meet the individual's need; and

Such other factors as the department considers necessary to insure service is provided only to those persons whose chore service needs cannot be met by relatives, friends, nonprofit organizations, other persons, or by other programs or resources. In determining the level of services to be provided under this chapter, the client shall be assessed using an instrument designed by the department to determine the level of functional disability, the need for service and the person's risk of long-term care facility placement. [ 1995 1st sp.s. c 18 s 36 ; 1989 c 427 s 5 ; 1981 1st ex.s. c 6 s 16 . Formerly RCW 74.08.545 .] NOTES: Conflict with federal requirements — Severability — Effective date — 1995 1st sp.s. c 18: See notes following RCW 74.39A.030 . Effective date — Severability — 1981 1st ex.s. c 6: See notes following RCW 74.04.005 .
